sites.title: Giza Pyramids Complex
sites.summary: Ancient mortuary complex featuring the Great Pyramid of Khufu and the Sphinx.
sites.description_md:
# Giza Pyramids Complex

The trio of pyramids built for pharaohs Khufu, Khafre and Menkaure are the only remaining wonders of the ancient world. The complex also includes the Great Sphinx and tombs for queens and nobles.

citations.label: Egypt Tours Portal – Giza Pyramids Complex

sites.title: Egyptian Museum
sites.summary: Museum housing 120,000 artefacts spanning Pharaonic history including Tutankhamun’s treasures.
sites.description_md:
# Egyptian Museum

Opened in 1902 on Tahrir Square, this museum safeguards mummies, jewellery, statues and papyri from ancient Egypt. Highlights include the golden mask of Tutankhamun and artefacts from the New Kingdom.

sites.title: Khan El Khalili Bazaar
sites.address: Al-Azhar St, El-Gamaleya, Cairo Governorate, Egypt
sites.summary: Bustling souk filled with spices, jewellery and handicrafts set within medieval lanes.
sites.description_md:
# Khan El Khalili Bazaar

Established in the 14th century, this labyrinthine market offers perfumes, textiles, gold and souvenir shops. The historic quarter is also home to traditional coffeehouses like El Fishawi.

citations.label: Egypt Tours Portal – Khan El Khalili Bazaar

sites.title: Memphis and Saqqara
sites.summary: Ruins of Egypt’s first capital and the Step Pyramid of Djoser – the earliest large stone structure.
sites.description_md:
# Memphis and Saqqara

Founded around 2925 BC, Memphis was the political and religious capital of early Egypt. Nearby Saqqara houses the Step Pyramid of Djoser, a precursor to the pyramids at Giza designed by Imhotep.

citations.label: Egypt Tours Portal – Memphis City & Saqqara Step Pyramid

sites.title: Muhammad Ali Mosque (Alabaster Mosque)
sites.summary: Ottoman-style mosque with slender minarets and alabaster interior dominating Cairo’s skyline.
sites.description_md:
# Muhammad Ali Mosque

Built between 1830 and 1848 within the Citadel of Salah al‑Din, this mosque features a central dome flanked by semi-domes and twin minarets. Limestone and alabaster cladding give it a distinctive gleaming appearance.

citations.label: Egypt Tours Portal – Muhammad Ali Mosque

sites.title: Salah El Din Citadel
sites.summary: Medieval fortress built by Saladin offering panoramic views and historic mosques and museums.
sites.description_md:
# Salah El Din Citadel

Constructed between 1176 and 1183 to protect against Crusaders, the citadel later housed Egypt’s rulers. Key attractions include the Mosque of Muhammad Ali, military museums and ancient gates.

citations.label: Egypt Tours Portal – Salah El Din Citadel

sites.title: Hanging Church
sites.summary: Coptic Christian church built above a Roman fortress, adorned with icons and wooden decorations.
sites.description_md:
# Hanging Church

Also known as Saint Virgin Mary’s Coptic Orthodox Church, the Hanging Church dates to the 5th century. It is suspended over the Water Gate of Babylon Fortress and contains over 100 icons.

sites.title: Al‑Azhar Mosque
sites.summary: Historic mosque and university complex regarded as a global centre of Islamic learning.
sites.description_md:
# Al‑Azhar Mosque

Founded in 970 AD by the Fatimids, Al‑Azhar grew into one of the world’s oldest universities. Its complex architecture reflects Fatimid, Mamluk and Ottoman influences, and it remains an active place of worship and study.

sites.title: Cairo Tower
sites.summary: 187‑metre communications tower with lotus‑inspired design offering panoramic views over Cairo.
sites.description_md:
# Cairo Tower

Completed in 1961 on Gezira Island, the concrete Cairo Tower resembles a lotus plant and stands 187 metres tall. Visitors ride elevators to an observation deck and revolving restaurant with views of the Nile and cityscape.

sites.title: Citadel of Qaitbay (Alexandria)
sites.summary: Sea‑front fortress in Alexandria built on the foundations of the ancient Lighthouse of Alexandria.
sites.description_md:
# Citadel of Qaitbay

Constructed in 1477 by Sultan Qaitbay, this fortress was built on Pharos Island using stones from the ruined ancient lighthouse. It protected the Mediterranean port and now houses a naval museum.

citations.label: Egypt Tours Portal – Citadel of Qaitbay
